title: Mike Posner celebrates 6-month walk across America by diving into the ocean
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Mike Posner couldn’t contain his excitement at finishing his walk across America and it’s absolutely deserved.

The 31-year-old took to Instagram to share a video of him triumphantly coming out of the surf at Redondo Beach in California, where he ended his six-month tumultuous journey.

He captioned the boomerang video: ‘My name is Mike Posner and I walked across America. Keep Going.’

Mike also posted a series of post-trek videos to his Instagram story, including a photo of him staring across the ocean, as well as a well-deserved massage on the beach.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The Cooler Than Me singer was trekking from the east to west coast in honour of Mac Miller, Avicii and his own late father.

Last week, he posted a video explaining exactly how he wanted the last day to go down.

While trekking through the Californian desert, he revealed he wanted to do the last day alone.

(Picture: Mike Posner / Instagram)

He explained: ‘You guys have been asking about the last day. I’m doing the last day alone so I’m not going to tell you what time on Sunday I’m getting to Redondo Beach, I’m not gonna tell you my route.

Taking his last day very seriously, he revealed the moment is going to be ‘one of the most sacred’ of his life.

He said: ‘Don’t try to walk with me, I’m going to be in the zone. I’m not gonna be talking, I’m taking a vow of silence.’

It took him six months to complete the journey and it certainly had its highs and lows.

The biggest low came about when he was bitten by a baby rattlesnake and had to be airlifted to hospital to get the antidote.

He explained: ‘I had just crushed 16 miles and was going for 8 more when I got bit by a baby rattlesnake!

‘That venom is no joke! I got to the hospital and got the anti-venom in time. Shout outs to G and Mike from the chopper team and Bo and Cassie and Whitney (my nurses),’ he added.

Advertisement

Advertisement

You’re a real inspiration, Mike!

description: Mike Posner celebrated surviving his six-month walk across America by triumphantly diving into the Pacific Ocean.
